item.title: Drain fully blocked, 7th November
item.description:
Immediately outside 45 gratton road. On corner with Brandon place.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Gratton Road, Naunton, Cheltenham

item.title: Unkept trees on Cheltenham Road, 7th November
item.description:
Huge trees on the approach to winchcombe which are dangerous to pedestrians, local homeowners and traffic because of height, they sway in the wind and are leaning on the telephone cables. The pines from these trees also block the drains causing localised flooding.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Cheltenham Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Farm Lane, Warden Hill, Cheltenham

item.title: Large group of potholes that are occasionally filled and appear again. Road is so bad that you have to drive on the wrong side of the carriageway into oncoming traffic., 6th November
item.description:
A long stretch of new and previously badly-filled potholes on one side of the carriageway direction of travel Birdlip to Cheltenham. There are 3 sections of very poor road in this area, the worst of which is before a bend so you can't see the oncoming traffic.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface problem, 6th November
item.description:
Customer concerned about erosion of grass verge at location due to traffic driving over it to get around parked cars. States that there are cables buried under it that may become exposed. Reported that kerbs have become sunken which may be causing this issue.

item.title: Spreading weed on pavement and cracks, 6th November
item.description:
The pavement outside 14 and 16 Beverley Gardens is being covered by weed (pulling out of which lifts the tarmac or loosens the kerbstones). It is also cracking by the kerb, one of the property owners is 96 years old.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Footpath covered in spreading amounts of moss, 6th November
item.description:
The footpath alongside 8 and 10 Beverley Gardens is being covered over by slippery moss. This area was cleared of weed and moss by the GCC Community Team in 2021 but the moss has returned and the weed is starting to regrow through the tarmac pavement. When wet or icy it is a slip hazard.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beverley Gardens, Woodmancote, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.description:

item.title: Very large hole, covered by yellow plastic plate, 5th November
item.description:
Outside "The Old Gate", Castle Street. There is a deep hole which has been there since Autumn 2022. It has had a yellow plastic cover over it, however from time-to-time this gets moved. The street is dark at that point so if the cover is moved it is a hazard as the hole is around 30+cm deep and around the same diameter. It first appeared when Severn Trent AND GCC were working in the road. I am uncertain who caused it but it really is time it was fixed before someone trips or breaks their Anke (it's big enough) because the cover is moved.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Castle Street, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet
